full_text: Great to welcome @DamianHinds earlier this morning.  We discussed our shared commitment to maintaining the Common Travel Area, the shared challenges both countries face in meeting the demands of a rapidly changing world and how best to continue our country's education cooperation https://t.co/8AYiTeRQIN
Best of luck to the newly formed Killester Donnycarney Football Club https://t.co/2julsZ34Lw
We are also investing €8.4 billion in primary and post primary school buildings, with 20,000 school places being provided annually. Along with €2.2 billion invested in higher education infrastructure

Recently we launched a €2 million pilot programme for new in-school speech and language services, to recognize that early intervention can have a dramatic improvement on a child’s life chances #SchoolOfTheFuture

We have also invest almost €1.78 billion on special needs education, which is one fifth of the education budget to ensure children with special needs can fulfill their full potential. This includes recruiting 3,000 extra SNAs #SchoolOfTheFuture

We have reduced the pupil ratio in primary schools from 27:1 to 26:1 in September 2018 - their lowest ever. 5,000 extra teachers were recruited in the last two years and 1,200 more teachers are being recruited in September 2018 #schoolofthefuture
This investment is being used to increase the number of teachers, more SNAs and better resources for our children https://t.co/QhaecCryEf
We have increased investment in Education by over €1 billion in the last two years, bringing the Education budget to its highest ever at €10 billion #schoolofthefuture
As young people go back to school they will benefit from increased investment in education and curricular reforms designed to enable them to achieve their full potential https://t.co/6xSnPaqp9J
https://t.co/BtW1fYgrSr
Best wishes to Sheila Nunan on her retirement as announced today. She’s made an enormous contribution to our education system’s development @INTOnews

There will be a planned water outage in Sutton on Thursday, 23rd August 2018 to carry out essential maintenance. Water will be off between 10am - 4pm (approx.).  Areas affected: •Alden Drive/Park/Road. Fingal County Council apologizes for the disruption.
I launched the National Parents Council Post Primary Helpline in Croke Park this morning. The free phone number is 1800 265 165 https://t.co/34MqRDXf2i
Great to bump into Mícheál Ó Muircheartaigh in Croke Park this morning https://t.co/3GNU1yCVg1
A lot of happy faces in Holy Faith in Clontarf-congrats to all #LeavingCert https://t.co/VjNNIFEoNP
In Pobalscoil Neasain this morning to congratulate students and teachers #LeavingCert https://t.co/zcA2JOQYzg
The @NPCpp have a helpline open from today at 10am. The number is 1800 265 165 #LeavingCert

For students who may not have done as well as you hoped, don’t panic, take time to consider your options and remember that no matter what your results are today, there are opportunities for you #LeavingCert

To all those students receiving your results today-there are more opportunities now than ever before to help you achieve your ambitions in life, whether you choose the apprenticeship, traineeship, further education or third level route #LeavingCert
I would also like to acknowledge and pay tribute to all the teachers, parents, friends who supported and helped you along the way #LeavingCert
I would like to congratulate all those students receiving their #LeavingCert results this morning. You should all be very proud of the hard work you have put in and what you have achieved
Reminder - the parental preference for the patronage of the four new post primary schools to open in 2019 closes tonight at midnight https://t.co/qRG3uYQEZJ

The Higher Education innovation fund will target improving student retention / progression, innovation in teaching and student learning, and flexible, distance and e-learning opportunities. https://t.co/kKdiHi3hCq
Looking forward to working closely with @senatornoone in Dublin Bay North. A great candidate who will work tirelessly on local and national issues https://t.co/OMOtuHxhg2
PE and Computer Science will roll out at leaving cert subjects in September. We are providing grants to schools to make it happen  https://t.co/0EWNLslRqV

The Education (Admissions to School) Bill which will deliver a historic reform of how a child accesses their local school- making the process easier and fairer, has been signed into law by @PresidentIRL #BestinEurope

@PresidentIRL Michael D Higgins has today signed the Education (Admissions to School) Bill into law. This significant reform will make the process of school admissions easier for children and parents https://t.co/tODSteS2hx

Higher Education must be accessible for all in society and Technological Universities will provide a flexible teaching and learning framework to students that will ensure all including those from a disadvantage background reach their full potential

Following the enactment of the TU Act earlier this year this is an important step for the future of higher education in Ireland this is supported by the announcement of €4.4m toward the development of TU4Dublin today
TU4Dublin will see 3 of Dublin’s institutes of technology, DIT, IT Blandchardstown and IT Tallaght, coming together.
In @ditofficial with @campaignforleo @Paschald @mitchelloconnor today to approve the application for Ireland’s first Technological University in Dublin - TU4Dublin https://t.co/9moHNSmfAE

Turned the sod on a new €15m state of the art sports campus today in @itcarlow this morning with @PatDeeringTD. Fantastic contribution to the campus which will be a great asset to their many sports stars for years to come https://t.co/As8zgT8Iwc

The creation of Technological Universities, led by @mitchelloconnor is part of the Government’s plan to drive regional economic growth and development under Ireland Project 2040 and to make Ireland’s education system the #BestinEurope by 2026

I am delighted to announce my decision to grant TU4Dublin’s application for designation as Ireland’s first technological university @campaignforleo @mitchelloconnor @ditofficial @itbdublin @ittallaght @Paschald @KZapponeTD

I chaired a meeting of the National Skills Council this morning. We discussed a number of issues, including competiteness and productivity, both of which will be vital to jobs and economic growth in the years ahead
I look forward to working with my government colleagues to raise awareness to the benefits of new technology while safeguarding our children online

New technology is revolutionising our world, bringing with it fantastic opportunities but also challenges. Education has an important role to play in equipping our citizens, particularly our children, with the skills to negotiate life in a fast changing 21st century
With @campaignforleo this morning to launch the government’s Action Plan for Online Safety @DenisNaughten @jimdalytd @SeanKyneTD @NPCpp https://t.co/gnA3XTa4xn
Launching the Darndale Belcamp Village Centre CLG strategic plan 2018-2021. Great to see ambition continuing in this important community facility https://t.co/cF6qvDNZ5Y

The School Admissions Bill will provide the Minister with the power to compel a school to open a special class and also provides that irish medium schools can give priority to irish speaking children. Thanks particularly to @ThomasByrneTD for his work on these provisions

The School Admissions Bill will make it easier for parents to access their local school and to enrol their children in a school that best meets their needs. Thanks to all TDs and Senators who worked on this bill

Education (Admission to Schools) Bill has this evening passed the Dáil and Seanad and will now go to the President. Historic reforms in this Bill will remove religion as a criteria in admissions in virtually all primary schools, ban waiting lists, end fees relating to admissions
Cooking up a storm on @IrelandAMTV3 this morning! https://t.co/ouPpCVOXKD

Technological Universities are a crucial part of this government’s drive to build strong regional hubs, which will be the engine of our economy. I will now consider this submission and will propose my decision by the end of July @mitchelloconnor

I'd like to welcome the TU4Dublin application from @ditofficial @itbdublin and @ittallaght which myself and @mitchelloconnor just received. The TU4Dublin consortium would be the first technological university in Ireland if approved
I recognise the crucial role the education system plays i the promotion and advancement of the Irish language. Some 28 actions in this plan are education-focused https://t.co/j0MLxJGdfU
Trying my hand at block laying on this summer morning on the site of the new €5m school for St Francis of Assisi NS Belmayne https://t.co/cbLlirZx17
Beginning my week turning the sod on Belmayne ETNS. The new €5m building will provide a new 16 classroom state of the art school for the Belmayne community https://t.co/gjcHOOJFH1
These schools will receive an additional €15,000 funding and extra teaching resources as well as the extra supports they will also receive under the Gaeltacht Schools policy
We want to see life on the islands flourish. The local school is key to this and I recognise the unique challenges island schools face
Today I announced ring fenced funding for island post primary schools in the Gaeltacht
I’ll be on #twip shortly. Great way to spend a Father’s Day morning!
Speaking at the National Parents a Council Primary Conference. Parents have great ideas on how we should shape a child’s experience in education https://t.co/n1li9S2ugc
Will be answering #LeadersQuestions this morning in the Dàil @FineGael @merrionstreet
Some great science projects in @steithnes https://t.co/4L7R3UEQP4

Congratulations to the 150 schools chosen to participate in the first phase of Creative Schools. We must nurture our children's creativity and ensure that the Arts thrive in our schools @josephamadigan https://t.co/GGXpAecX3s

Budget 2018 allocated €122m for apprenticeship training, an increase of almost 24% on the previous year. This will allow the Government to deliver 10 more apprenticeship programmes and over 6,000 more apprenticeship registrations in 2018.

Announcing €8m today to enable IoTs across the country to purchase equipment and update their infrastructure so that they can deliver a new modernised syllabi in 13 trades – from Brickwork to Aircraft Maintenance, supporting almost 2,300 apprentices
We’ve committed to doubling the number of apprenticeships and traineeships by 2020

Apprenticeships were one of the great casualties of the recession – registrations fell by 80% over the period. I'm determined to not only reverse this trend and rebuild traditional pathways but to significantly expand apprenticeships into new industries
Visiting St Declan’s NS with @ReginaDo to chat to Frank before he retires after 44 years https://t.co/1TuGYfY9Lp
Very engaging Q&A with the senior students of Slane NS with @HMcEntee https://t.co/9BGlpDv5XJ
Great to be in St Mary’s Special School Navan with @Damien_English @HMcEntee @ReginaDo https://t.co/ekwhhHRJhm
In Ard an Rí Community National School with @Damien_English meeting students https://t.co/TfrnT9imwC
I believe communication with schools and local stakeholders is essential as we continue to develop policies and initiatives to improve our education system
In St Anne’s Loreto NS, Navan to discuss fulfilling the potential of early years learners right through to junior cycle with local education stakeholders https://t.co/BTMXEsR9u1
Planting for the planet with St Laurence’s NS Baldoyle https://t.co/y0U3cNnFXY
Will be on @BreakfastNT and @morningireland shortly to wish all those starting State Exams this morning and the impact of the liquidation of Sammon yesterday
The very best of luck to all sitting the State Exams tomorrow #leavingcert2018 #juniorcert2018 https://t.co/XxOEg3OTgm
I'm very sorry to hear of the passing of Prof. John Coolahan. He was a giant of Irish Education who made a huge contribution over many decades. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a anam uasal dílis.

Delighted to be in Kildare to open the new €4m building for Gaelscoil Mhic Aodha with @martinheydonfg. Tá an-infheistíocht déanta ag rialtas na tíre seo i scoileanna, breis agus ceithre mhilliúin euro anseo, chun todhchaí dearfa san oideachas a chinntiú don aos óg https://t.co/hZlsdVHjQ3

The School Admissions Bill will also provide for a situation where a child (with special educational needs or otherwise) cannot find a school place, and allow the National Council for Special Education or Tusla to designate a school place for the child

The School Admissions Bill will also ban fees relating to admissions in non-fee charging schools. Where a school is not oversubscribed (approximately 80% of schools) it must admit all students applying under this bill.
The Bill now provides for a power to compel a school to open a special class. Thanks to @ThomasByrneTD for his work in this area.
The School Admissions Bill will also ban waiting lists, to ensure that parents who move to a new area, or parents who rent, are not disadvantaged

The Dàil has tonight passed the School Admissions Bill, including my amendment to remove the role that religion plays in school admissions in virtually all primary schools. The legislation will have a historic impact on how children access their local school.

It is not fair that parents, who might otherwise not do so, should feel pressure to baptize their children in order to gain admission to their local school. That is why I am proposing to remove the role that religion plays in school admissions in virtually all primary schools
Tonight I am bringing the School Admissions Bill through the Dàil. It will make it easier for parents to access their local schools and to enroll their children in a school that meets their needs.

On @PatKennyNT now to discuss our new process for transferring existing schools to multi or non denominational patronage. Parents of pre school children are being surveyed in 16 areas across the country, asking if they would like to see more choice in their area

Martin Naughton speaking today at the @tcddublin #STEM Institute. Martin and his family have made the single largest philanthropic donation in the history of the state to the Institute. €25m - an incredible contribution to Irish society https://t.co/VJlsjZbTtS

In @tcddublin with @mitchelloconnor and Dr Martin and Carmel Naughton today to launch a new €60m #STEM institute to cater for an extra 1,800 students. This fantastic investment will have a significant impact on our plans to make Ireland a European leader in STEM education https://t.co/xOtghrykGu
@Castletown_NS thanks for your comment. The circular is available online here: https://t.co/tyg76ldzot

I’ll be on @LunchtimeLiveNT shortly on our new circular directing schools to consult parents and students on the use of smart phones and tablets
Viewing and hearing the great achievements of all the students in Cashel Community School with @VoteNo1Ahearn https://t.co/dU1556DcKC
Delighted to celebrate Liam Ahearn’s 31 years as chairperson of the board of management of Grange NS with @VoteNo1Ahearn today. https://t.co/D8LQdFvTQe
In Leugh NS Co Tipperary to announce over 900 new SNAs with @VoteNo1Ahearn https://t.co/U0eeLhy4CW

Strong relationships between education and enterprise will allow us to continue to meet the skill needs of our economy. I believe engagement with students, parents, teachers, enterprise and all other stakeholders is key to developing our Education system
We will treble the number of apprenticeships including 50 in entirely new fields. It is important we champion Apprenticeships & Traineeships to continue the increase in uptake

In LIT Thurles Campus for my Action Plan for Education forum with stakeholders from Tipperary to discuss meeting the needs of senior cycle students and the skill needs for work and enterprise https://t.co/6qb6gvZ3xl
In Coláiste Mhuire this morning to discuss the recent the significant additional accommodation of 5 new classrooms and 2 special education classrooms https://t.co/Vv46lcEscq
Delighted to guest chair @Tipperary_FG agm tonight @VoteNo1Ahearn https://t.co/tP9tfEyISC
Fitting in some story time at the opening of the new €4.3m Glasnevin Educate Together NS https://t.co/I7ldsy1hVp

Extra funding in 2018 from the National Training Fund will expand the number of apprenticeships by 1,500, traineeships by 1,500, springboard participants by 1,500 and Skillnets participants by 5,000. We are investing to make Ireland a leader in responding to skills needs https://t.co/5UOo1z6UGb

With government colleagues today to speak about the measures we are introducing in my own area to reduce crisis pregnancies and support women who find themselves in such situations #VoteYes #Repeal8th https://t.co/XLfJH0FxCZ
This is about early intervention, joined up thinking and giving every child the opportunity to fulfil their full potential https://t.co/DznlQpMkE0
Great welcome in Presentation Primary School in Warrenmount this morning for the launch of our in-school therapeutic supports model with @KZapponeTD https://t.co/7WzShTyjq2
Identifying a speech and language issue in a child, and dealing with that issue, can have a dramatic impact on that child's life prospects
Speaking to @PatKennyNT about our new speech and language programme in schools. 150 schools and pre-schools to participate. I want to give every child a chance to fulfil their potential.
The last amendment, will give the Minister of Education the power to require a school to open a special class for children with special educational needs, when the NCSE deems it necessary to do so

This amendment will allow Irish medium schools (where it is their policy to do so) to give priority in admission to students who have a reasonable age appropriate level of oral fluency in the Irish language, taking account of any special educational needs a child might have
The second amendment is to provide for Irish medium schools to give priority to Irish speaking children
Schools that are not oversubscribed must continue to accept all applicants, regardless of religion
These changes will only impact oversubscribed primary schools (approx 20%), which are predominately locates in large urban areas.

The exception for minority faith children, is because only 1 out of every 20 of our primary schools are of minority ethos and they need to ensure that children of minority faith can access an education through their ethos, if that is their choice
Minority religion families, because of their small size within the overall population, could find it difficult to access schools of their own religious ethos
The changes balance the rights of three different groups; minority religion families, catholic families, and non-denominational families
Under the proposed new law, there will be a protection to ensure that a child of minority faith can still access a school of their faith

Now on @morningireland to discuss the same. This is about balance and fairness. I don’t think it’s fair that parents feel pressure to baptise their child to get into their local school when they would not otherwise do so https://t.co/JuG3JBkcuY
The government has approved an amendment that will remove religion as a criterion which can be used in school admissions in over 95% of our primary schools

While 90% of our primary schools are of a Catholic ethos, recent figures show that over 20% (and growing) of our parent-age population is non-religious. In addition recent marriage statistics for 2017 show that only approximately 51% of marriages occurred in a Catholic ceremony
Parents should not feel pressured to baptise their child to get access to their local school
As I have said before, I believe that it is unfair that a local child of no religion is passed over in favour of a child of religion, living some distance away for access to their local school
The first of of these amendments will remove the role of religion in school admissions for virtually all primary schools
These 3 changes are amendments to the Education (Admissions to School) Bill 2016, which were approved by cabinet yesterday
Today I am announcing 3 changes which will have a major impact on how a child accesses their local school
Will be on @BreakfastNT shortly to discuss our changes to make it easier for a child to access their local school https://t.co/sv4aoaQoTF
At Mount Lucas training Centre getting an update on their training programmes and courses @MarcellaCK @CllrLiamQ https://t.co/s3hMHkTC8E
Continuing my day with @MarcellaCK opening the new €12m Tullamore College and learning all about the great achievements of the students https://t.co/MKTea0StlC
Opening new €6m school for Scoil Mhuire NS Tullamore @MarcellaCK https://t.co/0uwDGUY9sO
Great sing song with @MarcellaCK and all the students and staff of Coolanarney NS in their new extension https://t.co/RxcARvAf2Q

Addressing the @JMB_Secretariat conference in Galway. Speaking about how education has transformed ireland. In the last 40 years we have gone from 1 million at work to 2 million at work. Education has played a fundamental role in this transformation https://t.co/MKZdTC8Tf5
There is still time to check the register to make sure you are able to vote - see https://t.co/oX9nE5ERhA before May 8th #ReadySteadyRegister https://t.co/uzFJFiu6Oq

In @Combilift this afternoon. Martin & his team have shown fantastic leadership in developing their engineering traineeship. As a govt, we are committed to doubling the number of trainees by 2020. Programs like this one are a fantastic option for anyone considering their options https://t.co/MFpuKFGBpB

Delighted to join @Paschald & @mitchelloconnor this morning to turn the sod on €220m building project in DIT Grangegorman. This project will cater for 10,000 students and 600 staff on the 52,000m2 development. https://t.co/1ti4oOpox0

Irish Water, will begin works in the coming weeks to replace old cast iron public water mains on Balscadden Rd Howth. Irish water will hold an information evening on these works on Wed 2nd May @17:30 in The Hall Howth National School
Great to receive an update on the construction of the new €6m 24 classroom school for Sixmilebridge NS with @joecareytd @PatBreen1 https://t.co/M5quRJ3tF4

Delighted to official open St Patrick’s Comprehensive new €4m extension in Shannon with @PatBreen1 & @joecareytd This extension will provide state of the art facilities including new labs, an art room and home ec room. https://t.co/cVLPGrBb3f
It is great to see some DEIS clusters reviewing the transitions and I would welcome further clusters undertaking a review of transitions between early years and primary or primary and post primary
The transitions our students take in our education system is a very big step for each child and I am conscious that we make these experiences a positive experience for all children

Parents play a pivotal role in the education of their children particularly in their early formative years. Aistear recognises the important role parents play and it is important we continue to support parents from all backgrounds in our education system.
We must continue to diversify our foreign languages programme at primary and post primary levels. The NCCA are actively reviewing the best methods of teaching foreign languages at all levels

In @stflannans today for my Action Plan for Education panel discussion on fulfilling the full potential of early years learners right through to Junior Cycle. It is important we listen to all our of stakeholders as we continue to develop our education system https://t.co/1zs6gu7oKr
In Gaelscoil Kilrush with @PatBreen1 this morning https://t.co/bZeQ9f8oPk
Congratulations to all #PressPass awardees today. A strong, independent media is a fundamental pillar of our democracy https://t.co/YCUJSuunjT

We will be building a 1,000 pupil post primary school and a 24 classroom primary school on this site in Harold's Cross. We are currently building nearly 20,000 extra school places every year around the country https://t.co/JdYFLF0Gxl
Encouraging men to vote #repealthe8th with government colleagues this morning in Stephens Green https://t.co/3fXI04kBXD
I have also been able to give extra resources to 110 schools in disadvantaged areas which are benefitting 20,000
